page.title: 18Local History _ The Vicarage
page.content: Records show that a vicarage existed next to the church in 1736."A vicarage house consisting of three bays or something better,there is some little brick a stone about it,and the greater part of it with clay walls and it is covered with thatch".The vicarage has been rebuilt at least once and the present building is mostly Georgian.In 1932 the vicarage was sold into private hands,in actual fact the new owner exchanged his substantial residence near Lincoln Cathedral for the Vicarage and about 80 acres of land.The Vicarage has since changed hands on several occastions and within the last two years it has been sold again to become a private school for mentally handicapped pupils.A newer smaller vicarage now stands in Station Road.This is a modern building reflecting the life style of 1985.
